attributes.action: Call a General Election to be held this June to break the brexit deadlock.
attributes.background: The Government has failed to get their Withdrawal Agreement through The House of Commons. If the deal is rejected again, the government should call a General election to be held this June. This will allow all parties to state their brexit plans in a manifesto and will break the brexit deadlock.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it's very similar to petitions we already have open. 
 
You might like to sign and share one or more of these petitions. 

Have another general election  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/235480

If Theresa May resigns as Prime Minister a general election must be held.  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/252449
